instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2442: What is A2442? A2442 is a model number for a 14 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3650, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02098..
definitions.A2485: What is A2485? A2485 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3651, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02100, 820-02382..

threads.title: Macbook M1/M2
threads.message:
"Warning: The latest 14-inch 16-inch„ÄÅM1 PRO MAX LCD screen/full lcd assembly is encrypted by Apple,  it will not work when you change it.
So We're not selling 14" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  16 " <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> for now".
Somebody says this, is this true?

threads.title: Macbook M1/M2
threads.message:
For M1 Pro, you can change the LCD assembly, but will get a weird image.
Several shadows, especially on top side, also when you move a folder icon on the desktop.
Tested with 3 M1 Pro 14", all with same problem.
Such replacement finally needs a calibration, which can be done with Apple GSX account only.

Not sure for M2, but I suppoose to be similar.
